heading: c&w's high-bandwidth gambit
subheading: cable & wireless promises to deliver broadband access to 60 us cities by 2001. the us$670 million investment paves the way for the next generation internet.
author: wired news report
text: britain's cable & wireless will invest us$670 million in the united states to spur development of the next generation internet, providing high-speed data, messaging, and voice networking. cable & wireless said in a statement tuesday that it will link more than 60 metropolitan areas with the most advanced routing and switching technology available.the next generation internet is an effort initiated by the us government and academic institutions to create a broadband internet that can reliably handle high-bandwidth multimedia applications like interactive video, and stored video-on-demand.the company said it expects to complete its network in 2001, but will bring portions of the network online as they are completed.the usa network will link with cable & wireless' european and asia/pacific segments.
